intro: Cynoglossum persicum, commonly known as Persian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. Cynoglossum persicum is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
